py_colors module¶

This module provides access to predefined (Matplotlib) or self-produced colors and color maps.

@author Petter Lind @date 2015-05-18

py_colors.getcolormap(cmap_name, custom=False)[source]¶

Function to retrieve colormap, either customized (custom=True) or available through Matplotlib predefined colormaps.

cmap_name: string
String, giving name of colormap to be retrieved.
custom: Boolean
Logical indicating self-produced (custom=True) or Matplotlib colormap.
cmap: Matplotlib colormap object
py_colors.getsinglecolor(color_name)[source]¶

Function to retrieve single custom color.

color_name: string
String, giving name of color to be retrieved.
color: Matplotlib color object
py_colors.norm_colors(bounds, ncolors, clip=False)[source]¶

In addition to min and max of levels, this function takes as arguments boundaries between which data is to be mapped. The colors are then linearly distributed between these ‘bounds’.
